alert.note: Alert for Allen; Woodson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 23 at 3:39PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT CDT TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of Southeast Kansas, including the following counties, Allen, Labette, Montgomery, Neosho, Wilson and Woodson. * WHEN...From Midnight CDT tonight through Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Widespread rainfall with amounts ranging from 2 to 4 inches are expected tonight through Tuesday evening. Locally higher amounts are possible.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
